text: Making a method private in a python subclass
Is it possible to make a public method private in a subclass ?
I don't want other classes extending this one to be able to call some of the methods .

code:
class A:
    def __init__(self):
        #do something here

    def method(self):
        #some code here

class B(A):
    def __init__(self):
        A.__init__(self)
        #additional initialization goes here

    def method(self):
        #this overrides the method ( and possibly make it private here )

text: from this point forward , I don't want any class that extends from B to be able to call method .
EDIT : a "logical" reason for this is that I don't want users to call methods in wrong order.
